page.title: 03Bethlem Royal Hospital
page.content: Bethlem Royal Hospital is situated at the crossroads of Monks Orchard Rd, Wickham Rd and Bridle Rd. It was foun- ded over 730 years ago. The function of the hospital is to help and look after people who are men- tally ill. The Bethlem Royal Hospital's job has changed over the years, as have the buildings it has been housed in. In 1674 it was decided that the hospital house was old, weak and ruinous, too cramped and never held more than sixty people. It must be rebuilt somewhere else. It was built on the Monks Orchard Estate in this century. There were four wards: Tyson, Fitzmary, Gresham and Whitley, each one having its own gar- den. At the moment, Bethlem is run by the National Health Service. Martin Kahl, Oak lodge.
